docs.title: Home

docs.text: A clearing operation is when you charge money from a credit card. POST /api/pay { "sale_price": "2500", "currency": "ILS", "product_name": "Pizza" } sale_price - The price in cents currency - The currency - ILS, USD, EUR etc, etc, product_name - The name of the product. If everything went OK you'll get a 200 status code and the response: { "message": "The clearing process went OK" } If not, you'll get something 400 status code and en error like: { "message": "Something went wrong during the clearing. Please check logs" }
docs.title: Clearing

docs.text: In order to get information about the sale that we did we need to create a simple REST request: GET /api/sales Here is an example: [ { "id": 1, "payme_sale_code": 125, "product": "Pizza with pineapple", "price": 2500, "currency": "ILS", "created_at": "2019-01-28 22:23:10", "updated_at": "2019-01-28 22:23:10" } ] id - The ID of the entry in the DB payme_sale_code - The sale number we got from payme product - The name of the product price - The price - in cents currency - The currency which used in the transaction created_at - Date when the entry created updated_at - Date when the entry last updated
